The player who has killed the greatest number of sea monsters takes the statue and wins 5 extra points at the end of the game — and if you do not fight, you may get injured...

Name: Expo Playing Cards
Description:
A baseball game played with a single deck of 56 cards depicting different actions, either defensive or offensive, happening during a baseball game. Even with Expo in its name, the game is not officially affiliated with the Montreal Expos.

According to the rulebook, the game can be played 3 different ways:

Game 1: Simply shuffle the deck and flip cards to "simulate" a nine innings game.

Game 2: Two players, each simultaneously completing a half-inning,  alternate drawing and playing cards to either accumulante runs or give 3 outs to their opponents. This is the recommended rule set in the rule book.

Game 3: A variant of game 2 but played with 4 peoples, in partnerships.

Name: World of Happy
Description: World of Happy is a roll-and-move game given away at McDonald's restaurants.  In the game, players roll a die (made by folding a punched-out section of the game board into a cube) and move to the next matching symbol on a track.  One side of the die causes loss of a turn, and some space move the player forward or allow skipping of part of the track.  The first player to reach the "World of Happy" at the end of the track wins.

Name: 돌진소녀 (Rush Girl)
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The girl who oversaw morning!

You have to get to the school quickly to avoid obstacles to school!
ëŒì§„ì†Œë…€ ("Rush Girl") is a real-time game that requires fast pace and awareness.


     All cards are mixed well and divided into 7 cards.
         At this time, players should not look at the cards they have received.
    
     Place a 'safe' card in the reach of everyone.
     Pick one of the remaining cards at random and put the safe card
         Leave it aside. (In case of 5-player play, one card is left.)
    
     Take the card you received at the same time in your hand.
     The game is played in real time.
         Check the last obstacle!
         Check the card in your hand!
         If you can fix it, shout out the next obstacle!
             Only the first card you put on the old card is accepted.

Name: Polar
Description:
Polar
     Square board, 9x9 or 11x11 or 13x13
     Black and white pieces


				
				
					RulesPieces are placed on empty intersections of the board. Connections are orthogonal only.

The board is initially empty.

One of the players takes two pieces (black and white) and places them on any arbitrary adjacent spaces. The other player may now decide on which color to play.

Black starts, then players take turns placing one of their pieces on an empty space according to the following rules.

Connected pieces form a group, and same-colored connected pieces within a group are called a section. A group may never consist of more than two sections.

Player may only pass if they have no moves left. They must play again in a successive turn when moves are available again.

The game ends when both players have to pass.

				
				
					ScoreGroups with one or equally sized sections score zero points. For any other group, the player holding the majority section gets the triangular number section points: 
T(n) = n*(n+1)/2

The player with the highest total score wins. Games can end in a draw.

Name: Super Sumo!
Description:
Description from the designer:

Super Sumo is simple party game for 2 to 4 players.

This dexterity game can be played on a table or directly on the floor.

There are 2 teams : the Blue Sumos and the Red Sumos.

Each team controls 4 sumos (4 circular coaters).

In this game, each team is trying to control The golden cookie.

The golden cookie (a tiny token) is put on the center of the playing area at the beginning of the game.

Players throw their sumos in order to be as close as possible to the golden cookie.

When all the sumos have been launched, the round is over. The team which controls the golden cookie (the closest sumo) wins 1 point.

The first team with 3 points wins the game.

Name: Azzelij
Description:
The arabic word "Azzelij" means "small polished stone" and is known as the historical origin of the world "Tile".

In Azzelij, two to four players compete to build a beautiful tile panel, trying to get more points with your own colors.

Each player have 12 tile pieces at their stock pile that are used do form circle patterns, like an artist trying to get the best part of the pannel! At first round, each player get 3 tiles from their pile and than draw one each subsequent round, maintaining 3 options to play at almost all time. In your turn, you must place one tile (considering that you cant extend the panel mor than 7x7 tiles away) and optionally rotate 90º clockwise another placed tile (only if the rotated tile is not forming a circle pattern yet). The turns goes until the 7x7 panel is created.

You score one point creating circle patterns with absolute majority of your colour and 3 points if the circle created has only your color. You also score bonus points (1 for each circle) if the scored circle is created only by your pieces.

Ar fisrt glance, Azzelij seems to be a simple tile placement, but as the game flows players faces lots of hard decisions to make: May I get a point or avoid another player to get a better position? May I close the 7 piece limit to stop opponents to grow at one edge or stay creating my pattern? May I risk to get a full-colored circle of mine or get two or more majority-only circle points?

As the game flows, the decisions ar harder to take and the panel gets its 7x7 piece formation, that increases the difficulty and fun!

Name: Isle of Skye: Journeyman
Description:
Becoming a king is hard, but being a king is even harder. You need warriors to protect your kingdom, merchants to keep your treasury liquid and heralds which proclaim your popularity across the kingdom. Luckily, your best mate has agreed to take over the hard graft so that you concentrate becoming a glory chieftain.

Isle of Skye: Journeyman, the first big expansion to Isle of Skye, contains new personal player boards indicating your progress in terms of strength, prosperity and popularity. As each progress step has requirements to be met, the personal player boards affect tile selling and placement. However, in order to claim the next level of development and gain potential rewards, it’s not sufficient to place the corresponding tiles only. A new pawn (the journeyman) needs to travel the kingdom and "activate" the tiles. In addition, four new scoring tiles are contained respecting the new challenges of Isle of Skye: Journeyman.

Name: Pushido
Description:
What's Pushido?
It's a pitching game for 2 players. You're a good sumo fighting against evil sumos!

What's in the bag?

+  6 tiny wooden disks (1 blue sumo et 5 red sumos).

+ 12 tiny stickers (2 blue sumos and 10 red sumos).

+  1 rules card (English and French).

+ 1 Zip bag.

How to play?

+  Put all the tokens randomly in the center of the table.

+ The youngest player starts, he pitches the blue sumo with one of his fingers.

+  He tries to push one red sumo out of the table.

+ If he succeed, he wins 1 point and plays again.

+  If he doesn't, the second player plays.

+ In turns, the game continues until there is a winner.

How to win?

+  If a player pushes the blue sumo out of the table, he loses the game.

+ If a player has 3 points and the blue sumo is on the table, he wins the game.

Name: Heroes Wanted: Elements of Danger
Description:
Earth! Air! Fire! Water! Danger? Zeta City has seen its share of heroes, but none the likes of these. Elemental heroes join the fray, harnessing the very forces of nature against an all new bevy of criminal geniuses, sentient websites, and opinionated baddies!

But wait! There's more! Not only does this expansion for Heroes Wanted add a brand new hero type to your already near-infinite game play options, it also provides even more content for the other hero types in the game. Players will now have bonus cards unique to their hero, as well as never-before-seen epic actions! And the fun doesn't stop there! Elements of Danger also introduces improved basic actions to make your hero even more unique!

Be a hero. Save the day. Make the team!

Name: Twangled
Description: A cooperative party game where players hold elastic bands and tangle the group by stepping over or under the bands. The goal of the game is to untangle the group so that everyone is facing the middle.
